newsitem.title: UK: Eurobonds-Expected new issues-Middle East & Africa.
newsitem.headline: Eurobonds-Expected new issues-Middle East & Africa.

text.p: Following is a summary of expected new issues from emerging market borrowers in the international primary debt market.
The list was compiled from information provided by borrowers, banks mandated to lead manage the issues and other primary market sources. All terms and conditions are indicative.
Details of upcoming bond issues can be telephoned into the London newsroom on +44 171 542 7748
+ EGYPT, $1.0 bln bonds to retire commercial bank debt, around
+ ELECTRICITE DU LIBAN, $100 million 10-year bond, principal gtd
by World Bank, interest by Lebanon, Merrill (OFFICIAL)
+ ISRAEL AIRPORTS AUTHORITY, $100-$150 million debut bond, held
talks with Bank of America, Bear Stearns, Lehman, Merrill
+ ISRAEL ELECTRIC, plans bonds worth up to $600 million in 1997
+ JORDAN to launch $70 million debut Eurobond by October (OFFICIAL)
+ LEBANON, $400 million in Q3 1997 to refinance maturing bond. PM
Harari has proposed a $1.0 bln 30-year bond to finance
emergency social spending, which would cover all 97 borrowing
+ TURKEY, to raise $2.0 billion in debt in 1997, eyeing yen
+ Turkey's EXIM BANK planning to issue Euro and Samurai bonds
